title: Absolut Vodka geometric sans bitmap font
content:
I would like to know what font or bitmap this is in the bold and regular:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130840im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69030.gif)   
   
Thanks,   
   
Laurie
author: toucadoo

comments.content:
The site where I found the bitmap is at:   
   
 [http://www.fashion.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130840/http:/www.fashion.net/)   
   
They seem very similiar to bauhaus, the lowercase 'a' it appears different from the bauhaus bitmaps that I've found.   
   
Would anyone know where I can download this font?   
   
Thanks,   
   
Laurie
I don't know the answer--I checked the pixel sites I know of--but I hope you find this. This is a pretty cool pixel typeface.

Paul,   
   
Did you try contacting the administrators of the fashion.net site? They might be able to tell you what fonts were used in the design.   
   
 - Lex

Lex,   
   
I actually did email them asking for the indentification of the bitmap font but still no response.   
   
Thanks for looking ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130840im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Laurie

FontsForFlash's newest, FFF Spacedust, is pretty close to that bold sample.   
   
And I don't believe the top font is a just bold version of the bottom... far too thick.

[Hiairport](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130840/http:/dafont.com/en/search.php?text=absolut+vodka+trendsetter&nq=1&q=hiairport) and [Sci Fied Bitmap](http://web.archive.org/web/20050524130840/http:/dafont.com/en/search.php?text=absolut+vodka+trendsetter&nq=1&q=sci+fied+bitmap) are about the closest I've found to the thin font.
